title: Joey Barton reveals he was due to hold talks over Arsenal move until he got Gervinho sent off
text:
EFL RED AND BURIED Joey Barton reveals he was due to hold talks over Arsenal move until he got Gervinho sent off 
The then Newcastle midfielder was due to meet with Arsene Wenger in 2011 but discussions were shelved after incident By JAMIE GORDON Comments JOEY BARTON claims his dream move to Arsenal was derailed after he was sent off against them. 
The then Newcastle midfielder was due to meet with Arsene Wenger in 2011. News Group Newspapers Ltd 4 Gervinho was sent off following an off-the-ball clash with Joey Barton 
But Barton revealed in his book No Nonsense that he blew his audition when he clashed with Gervinho and got him sent off. 
Arsenal ended up leaving St James’ Park with a point after failing to break down Newcastle without the Ivorian forward. 
Barton – who joined QPR that summer instead – told Four Four Two : “No, intermediaries spoke on their behalf. “There was definitely some low-level interest, and before I got sent off against Arsenal, when the thing with Gervinho happened, I was due to hold some form of discussions with them. 
“But then it never came to be. Would I have liked to have played for Arsenal? Of course. Who wouldn’t?” 
Barton is back in the Premier League with Burnley after helping the Clarets win promotion to the Premier League last season before an ill-fated Rangers spell. 
He managed just eight appearances in Scotland and was suspended after a training ground row with team-mate Andy Halliday that followed a 5-1 defeat by the Old Firm rivals Celtic.
